item.title: TikTok asks for emergency pause to looming US ban
item.description: The app says the Supreme Court - and incoming Trump administration - needs more time to consider the case.

item.title: Google unveils 'mind-boggling' quantum computing chip
item.description: It solves in five minutes a problem computers now would need 10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 years to work out, Google says.

item.title: INFAMOUS: The Lake Waco Murders Part 2
item.description:
A community demands answers when three teenagers are found brutally slain in a scenic lakeside park, and it breathes a collective sigh of relief as righteous local lawmen quickly zero in on the perpetrators. But when the dust finally settles, many are forced to ask: who pays the price when ego eclipses justice?

This is Part 2 of 2. Make sure to listen to INFAMOUS: The Lake Waco Murders Part 1 before diving into this one… you’re going to want to know the first part of this wild and twisty case.

And for more information on the 2025 Crime Junkie Tour, please visit our website!

item.title: TikTok set to be banned in the US after losing appeal
item.description: The app - which faces being banned in a matter of weeks - says it will now take its case to the Supreme Court.

item.title: Online star Hawk Tuah girl faces crypto coin criticism
item.description: Haliey Welch's "Hawk" digital coin shot up in price then lost 95% of its value just hours after it launched.

item.title: Is AI any good at choosing gifts?
item.description: With vast amounts of data do draw on, AI should be able to come up with good gift ideas, but does it?

item.title: What next for Bitcoin after bursting $100k barrier?
item.description: The rapid increase in price has been attributed to Donald Trump's election victory - can it continue?

item.title: Vodafone boss says prices won't rise after Three 'mega-merger'
item.description: The deal, which creates the UK's biggest mobile network, has had to overcome competition concerns.

item.title: MYSTERIOUS DEATH OF: Joyce Chiang in Fairfax
item.description:
This episode was originally released in Septemebr 2021, and is one of sixteen episodes from the archives we'll be bringing you every Thursday, now through end of year... for good reason! ;) We highly recommend you listen to each episode between now and end of 2024, and follow us on Instagram @crimejunkiepodcast so you're the first to know what's coming next! <3

One woman’s promising career in Washington, D.C. is cut short when she mysteriously vanishes one night on her way home from work.

item.title: Bitcoin surges past $100k for first time
item.description: Its record price is making headlines - but that's just one part of the cryptocurrency's tumultuous story.

item.title: Telegram U-turns and joins child safety scheme
item.description: It is the latest in a series of changes announced by the platform since its founder Pavel Durov was arrested.

item.title: Tech Life: How green is AI?
item.description: Tech Life meets leading AI scientist Sasha Luccioni, one of the BBC’s 100 Women 2024.

item.title: Stunning or rubbish? Jaguar's new concept car divides opinion
item.description: The carmaker's new look is praised as "exciting" but others say it should "go back to the drawing board".

item.title: People not AI will make games, PlayStation boss says
item.description: The gaming giant's joint CEOs reflect on its past and future as it celebrates its 30th anniversary.

item.title: Microsoft faces £1bn class action case in UK over software prices
item.description: It is alleged the tech giant overcharged companies for its Window Server software, used in cloud computing.

item.title: Watch: How Jaguar's shifted gears with its concept car
item.description: The company has been at the centre of a media storm as a result of its radical revamp.

item.title: Musk's record $56bn pay deal rejected for second time
item.description: The judge upheld her previous decision, saying board members who set the pay were too heavily influenced by Mr Musk.

item.title: 'Roll your eyes if you want, I'm a star': TikTok to hold first awards show
item.description: The UK's first TikTok Awards sees 72 creators, who have a combined follower count of over 101m, nominated.

item.title: Why is vintage audio equipment booming?
item.description: Music lovers are buying up old cassette, CD and record players and getting them fixed.

A community demands answers when three teenagers are found brutally slain in a scenic lakeside park, and it breathes a collective sigh of relief as righteous local lawmen quickly zero in on the perpetrators. But when the dust finally settles, many are forced to ask: who pays the price when ego eclipses justice?
